info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 3:06AM CDT by NWS Green Bay WI
info.description:
At 305 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Border Lakes Natural Area to 7 miles east of Squirrel Lake to 7 miles south of Willow Reservoir to 9 miles southwest of New Wood Wildlife Area. Movement was northeast at 45 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible.
Strong thunderstorms will be near... Tomahawk, Boulder Junction, Border Lakes Natural Area, and New Wood Wildlife Area around 310 AM CDT. Johnson Lake Barrens Natural Area and Rainbow Flowage around 315 AM CDT. Newbold and Gilbert around 320 AM CDT. Rhinelander and Woodboro around 325 AM CDT. Crystal Lake Scout Reservation around 330 AM CDT. Eagle River around 335 AM CDT.
Other locations impacted by these storms include Sayner, Bradley, Dudley, Lower Tomahawk River Natural Area, Harshaw, Hazelhurst, Upper Buckatabon Springs Natural Area, Otis, Mccord, and Otter Lake Campground.
info.instruction:
If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until these storms pass.

parameter.value: STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT LINCOLN...VILAS AND ONEIDA COUNTIES THROUGH 345 AM CDT
